attributes.comment:
This proposed raise in the USCIS for the I-600/600A, N-565, N-600 and fingerprinting
would make adoption no longer an option for some of us. We are an enlisted family so
our income is not fantastic. So far in our adoption we have had to apply for the I-600a
twice plus pay for the social worker to travel for the original homestudy and to update
the homestudy once due to a change of duty station. This increase would do more
harm to families in our situation. Please reconsider raising the fees or at the minimum
make the I-600a only a one time fee so the document is good until the adoption is
completed.
Such a drastic increase in citizenship would also hurt adopting families since we
already have the cost of the immigration forms and the travel to pick up our children.
Many families would not be able to afford such an important part of the adoption. It
would be a horrible thing not to be able to afford after all is said and done.
Perhaps a smaller increase would be just as beneficial for your department and not so
out of reach for us average people.
Thank you for your time.
E Shore

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Elouise Shore
